meaning: A jump or plunge into water.
example: the dive of a hawk after prey

meaning: A number or expression that is to be divided by another.
example: In "42 ÷ 3" the dividend is the 42.

meaning: Any of the genus Rumex of coarse weedy plants with small green flowers related to buckwheat, especially common dock, and used as potherbs and in folk medicine, especially in curing nettle rash.
A film, TV program, publication etc. which presents a social, political, scientific or historical subject in a factual or informative manner.
Something transposed from a thought to a document; the written account of an idea.
To make a donation; to give away something of value to support or contribute towards a cause or for the benefit of another.
example: He donated an etching from his own collection to the new art gallery.

meaning: A voluntary gift or contribution for a specific cause.
example: They were collecting donations for the elderly at Christmas.

meaning: A deep-fried piece of dough or batter, commonly made in a toroidal or ellipsoidal shape, and mixed with various sweeteners and flavors, sometimes filled with jelly, custard or cream.

A person who holds open the door at the entrance to a building, summons taxicabs, and provides an element of security; in apartment buildings, he also accepts deliveries and may perform certain concierge type services.
A file transfer to the local computer.
example: The download took longer than I expected.

meaning: To reduce in size or number.
example: Joe and Edna moved to a bungalow after deciding to downsize when the children had left home.

meaning: The lower floor of a house, at ground level.
example: The wind lifted up her skirt and I caught a glimpse of her downstairs.

meaning: The main business part of a city or town, usually located at or near its center.
example: John walked every day to his downtown job.

meaning: A downward trend, or the beginnings of one; a decline.
example: The downturn in the economy made it harder to find jobs.

meaning: To a drastic degree.
example: This recession has been drastically different.

meaning: A disadvantage; something that detracts or takes away.
example: Poor fuel economy is a common drawback among larger vehicles.

meaning: An open-topped box that can be slid in and out of the cabinet that contains it, used for storing clothing or other articles.
A tool used to remove material so as to create a hole, typically by plunging a rotating cutting bit into a stationary workpiece.
example: Wear safety glasses when operating an electric drill.

meaning: A period of unusually low rainfall, longer and more severe than a dry spell.
A percussive musical instrument spanned with a thin covering on at least one end for striking, forming an acoustic chamber, affecting what materials are used to make it; a membranophone.
example: Replace the drum unit of your printer.

meaning: To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.
example: Years of misuse have dulled the tools.

meaning: One that resembles or corresponds to another; an identical copy.
example: This is a duplicate, but a very good replica.

meaning: A durable thing, one useful over more than one period, especially a year.
An amount of time or a particular time interval.
example: Rationing will last at least for the duration.

meaning: A characteristic or manner of an interaction; a behavior.
example: Watch the dynamic between the husband and wife when they disagree.

meaning: Sharp; sour; acid.
example: I was eager to show my teacher how much I'd learned over the holidays.

meaning: A shaking of the ground, caused by volcanic activity or movement around geologic faults.
Careful with money so as not to spend too much; prudent; thrifty.
example: He was an economical person by nature.

meaning: (manner) In an economical manner; not wastefully; not extravagantly
An expert in economics, especially one who studies economic data and extracts higher-level information or proposes theories.
To practice being economical (by using things sparingly or in moderation, and by avoiding waste or extravagance).
An article in a publication giving the opinion of its editors on a given topic or current event.
example: editorial labours; editorial remarks

meaning: The property of being effective, of achieving results.
example: The effectiveness of the drug was well established.

meaning: In an efficient manner.
An electrical engineer.
A tradesman who installs, repairs and maintains electrical wiring and equipment.
By means of electronics, or of electronic technology.
Characterised by or exhibiting elegance.
example: an elegant solution

meaning: A mammal of the order Proboscidea, having a trunk, and two large ivory tusks jutting from the upper jaw.
example: Let's play hide and seek. I'll count. One elephant, two elephant, three elephant...

meaning: To raise (something) to a higher position.
example: The doctor told me elevating my legs would help reduce the swelling.

meaning: Anything that raises or uplifts.
One who is eligible.
The function or duty of an ambassador.
example: The American embassy to France is located in Paris.

meaning: An embedded reporter or journalist, such as a war reporter assigned to and travelling with a military unit, or a political reporter assigned to follow and report on the campaign of a candidate.
example: to embed something in clay, mortar, or sand

meaning: To surround with a wall, fence, etc.
example: to enclose lands

meaning: Possessing or pertaining to energy.
example: Cosmic rays are energetic particles from outer space.

meaning: An appointment, especially to speak or perform.
example: The lecturer has three speaking engagements this week.

meaning: Pleasant, capable of giving pleasure.
example: That was an enjoyable day; I had a lot of fun.
